lead_paragraph: Infertility means you cannot make a baby (conceive). Infertility is grouped into two categories: Primary infertility refers to couples who have not become pregnant after at least 1 year of unprotected sex (intercourse). Secondary infertility refers to couples who have been pregnant at least once, but are not able to get pregnant now.

snippet: The barriers that keep minorities from enjoying full access to the technological revolution have been widely commented on. Less talked about is another ''digital divide,'' the fact that fewer women are entering today's booming technology fields.  ...
lead_paragraph: The barriers that keep minorities from enjoying full access to the technological revolution have been widely commented on. Less talked about is another ''digital divide,'' the fact that fewer women are entering today's booming technology fields. Studies show that women are active users of the new technology and that female Internet users slightly outnumber male users. But the paucity of women creating that technology is cause for concern. The most recent National Science Foundation statistics show that between 1984 and 1997, the proportion of women receiving bachelor's degrees in computer science dropped from 37 percent to 27 percent. Currently, women make up only 20 percent of the information technology work force.
abstract: Editorial laments fact that fewer women are entering booming technology fields; says technology industry badly needs more workers and that women represent major untapped source of talent that could solve shortage (S)

headline.main: Technology's Gender Gap

snippet: To the Editor:    Thanks to Mr. McDonald for a stimulating article. But I would question his interpretation of ''Terminator 2: Judgment Day.'' He wrote that the special effects ''overwhelmed what story there was'' and ''supported narratives with a...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Thanks to Mr. McDonald for a stimulating article. But I would question his interpretation of ''Terminator 2: Judgment Day.'' He wrote that the special effects ''overwhelmed what story there was'' and ''supported narratives with about as much staying power as comic books.'' In fact, ''Terminator 2'' has a very important story to tell about our technological attitudes and anxieties in the late 20th century. Technology as both savior and destroyer, as male and capitalistic, are all important themes in the movie. ANDY COX San Francisco
abstract: Andy Cox letter on William McDonald's May 3 article on impact of movie special effects (S)

headline.main: On 'Terminator 2'

snippet: Using X-ray technology, art historians at Bristol University in England believe they have found a portrait of Henry Wriothesley, third Earl of Southampton and Shakespeare’s only known patron, the BBC reported. While preparing an oil portrait...
lead_paragraph: Using X-ray technology, art historians at Bristol University in England believe they have found a portrait of Henry Wriothesley, third Earl of Southampton and Shakespeare’s only known patron, the BBC reported. While preparing an oil portrait of Wriothesley’s wife, Elizabeth Vernon, for an exhibition, the historians discovered a ghostly male figure that had been painted over. From his appearance and long auburn hair, they concluded it was her husband. The experts said the find was significant, but they have no plans to chip away at the Vernon portrait to raise the specter.

headline.main: Shakespeare Patron Emerges, Ghostly
headline.print_headline: Shakespeare Patron Emerges, Ghostly

snippet: More than 7 out of 10 working women view technology as a critical factor in helping them attain higher salaries and better career opportunities. In addition, professional women earning more than $45,000 a year are three times more likely to use co...
lead_paragraph: More than 7 out of 10 working women view technology as a critical factor in helping them attain higher salaries and better career opportunities. In addition, professional women earning more than $45,000 a year are three times more likely to use computers heavily than others. Those were among the findings in a new national survey released last week by Penn & Schoen Associates, President Clinton's polling firm. The survey of 100 working women, commissioned by Avon Products Inc., was conducted in April and had a margin of error of plus or minus 4.7 percentage points.
abstract: Penn & Schoen Associates survey finds that over 7 out of 10 working women view technology as critical factor in helping them attain higher salaries and better career opportunities (S)

headline.main: Dutch Fertility Clinic Investigates Possible Sperm Mix-Up

snippet: WITHIN a year or so, people will be shopping by talking to their Web pages, and the Web pages will be talking back.    More cars will come equipped with talking computers that not only give directions to the gas station and read e-mail, but also s...
lead_paragraph: WITHIN a year or so, people will be shopping by talking to their Web pages, and the Web pages will be talking back. More cars will come equipped with talking computers that not only give directions to the gas station and read e-mail, but also surf the Internet for the driver. The question is, Who will actually be doing the talking?
abstract: Article reflects predictions and expectations of two experts in voice-synthesis, Stanford University Prof Clifford Nass and Dr Caroline Henton of Tellme Networks; gender of synthesized voices strongly conveys implications regarding information they deliver; drawings; photos (M)

Aug. 13]: Based on 1998 data, the federal government recently increased the average life expectancy of an American male or female by two years. The population that is experiencing this increase in life expectancy is the first generation to be exposed to radio waves.

snippet: VERITAS CAPITAL FUND L.P., -- New York, an investment firm, has announced plans to buy Stellex Electronics, San Jose, Calif., a maker of parts for the military and telecommunications industries, for $87.5 million in cash. Veritas also named a chie...
lead_paragraph: VERITAS CAPITAL FUND L.P., -- New York, an investment firm, has announced plans to buy Stellex Electronics, San Jose, Calif., a maker of parts for the military and telecommunications industries, for $87.5 million in cash. Veritas also named a chief executive, Gary Bloom, formerly a senior executive at Oracle Corp., replacing Mark Leslie, who will remain as chairman. EDGEWATER TECHNOLOGY INC., -- Fayetteville, Ark., which develops and maintains Web sites and commerce software for other companies, said it had sold its IntelliMark unit, which provides staffing for information-technology companies, to Charlesbank Equity Fund V for about $42.7 million in cash.

snippet: In the grand story of evolution that scientists have been reconstructing since Charles Darwin's voyage on H.M.S. Beagle, the chapter on mate selection reads something like this: males compete among themselves to attract females, showing off their ...
lead_paragraph: In the grand story of evolution that scientists have been reconstructing since Charles Darwin's voyage on H.M.S. Beagle, the chapter on mate selection reads something like this: males compete among themselves to attract females, showing off their antlers, bright plumage or other ornaments that signal good health. Females watch the display from the sidelines, aloof and picky, like wealthy patrons at an art exhibition. When a male meets a female's approval, she agrees to court him and finally grants him permission to impregnate her.
abstract: Zoologists and evolutionary experts are collecting evidence suggesting that female as well as male birds, fish and other animals develop ornamental features to attract opposite sex; photos (M)

snippet: One of the few all-male private colleges left in the United States, the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, has broken 117 years of tradition and decided to admit women.    The highly regarded science and engineering institute in Terre Haute, Ind...
lead_paragraph: One of the few all-male private colleges left in the United States, the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, has broken 117 years of tradition and decided to admit women. The highly regarded science and engineering institute in Terre Haute, Ind., will begin admitting women undergraduates in the 1995-96 academic year. Women have been allowed in graduate programs for 10 years.

headline.main: College to End a 117-Year All-Male Tradition
